questions.text: Which TV series features a chemistry teacher who turns to manufacturing methamphetamine?
questions.explanation: Breaking Bad (2008-2013) stars Bryan Cranston as Walter White, a chemistry teacher turned drug manufacturer.

questions.text: What is the name of the fictional country in the Marvel movie Black Panther?
questions.explanation: Wakanda is the fictional African nation home to T'Challa, the Black Panther.

questions.text: Which social media platform is known for its disappearing photo and video messages?
questions.explanation: Snapchat, launched in 2011, popularized the concept of disappearing messages and stories.

questions.text: Who played Iron Man in the Marvel Cinematic Universe?
questions.explanation: Robert Downey Jr. portrayed Tony Stark / Iron Man from 2008's Iron Man through 2019's Avengers: Endgame.

questions.text: Which animated TV show features the town of Springfield?
questions.explanation: The Simpsons, which debuted in 1989, is set in the fictional town of Springfield.

questions.text: What was the name of the viral dance challenge associated with Drake's 'In My Feelings'?
questions.explanation: The Kiki Challenge (or In My Feelings Challenge) went viral in 2018 with people dancing alongside moving cars.

questions.text: Which reality TV show features contestants competing on a deserted island for a million-dollar prize?
questions.explanation: Survivor, hosted by Jeff Probst, premiered in 2000 and features contestants competing in challenges on remote locations.

questions.text: In the DC Universe, what is Batman's real name?
questions.explanation: Bruce Wayne is the billionaire alter ego of Batman, the Dark Knight of Gotham City.

questions.text: Which K-pop group released the hit song 'Dynamite' in 2020?
questions.explanation: BTS released 'Dynamite' in August 2020, their first song entirely in English, which debuted at No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100.

questions.text: Which actress played Katniss Everdeen in The Hunger Games film series?
questions.explanation: Jennifer Lawrence starred as Katniss Everdeen across all four Hunger Games films (2012-2015).

questions.text: What color is the 'like' button on Facebook?
questions.explanation: Facebook's like button (thumbs up) is displayed in the platform's signature blue color.

questions.text: Which Marvel superhero is known as the 'God of Thunder'?
questions.explanation: Thor, based on the Norse deity, is known as the God of Thunder in the Marvel Universe.

questions.text: Which TV show popularized the phrase 'Winter is Coming'?

options.D: Lord of the Rings: Rings of Power

questions.explanation: 'Winter is Coming' is the motto of House Stark in Game of Thrones, based on George R.R. Martin's novels.

questions.text: Which comedian and actor starred in the sitcom 'Seinfeld'?
questions.explanation: Jerry Seinfeld co-created and starred in Seinfeld (1989-1998), often called 'the show about nothing.'

questions.text: What is the name of the viral 2015 internet debate about a dress being blue/black or white/gold?
questions.explanation: The Dress went viral in February 2015 when people disagreed on whether a photo showed a blue-and-black or white-and-gold dress.

questions.text: Which animated film features the song 'Let It Go'?
questions.explanation: Frozen (2013) features 'Let It Go,' performed by Idina Menzel as Queen Elsa, which won the Academy Award for Best Original Song.

questions.text: Who is the host of 'The Tonight Show' as of 2024?
questions.explanation: Jimmy Fallon has hosted The Tonight Show on NBC since 2014.

questions.text: In which year did the original iPhone launch?
questions.explanation: Steve Jobs unveiled the first iPhone on January 9, 2007, and it went on sale June 29, 2007.

questions.text: Which superhero's origin story involves being bitten by a radioactive spider?
questions.explanation: Peter Parker gained his powers after being bitten by a radioactive spider, becoming Spider-Man.

questions.text: What is the name of the fictional high school in 'Stranger Things'?
questions.explanation: Stranger Things is set in the fictional town of Hawkins, Indiana, and the older characters attend Hawkins High School.

questions.text: Which fashion designer is known for the iconic little black dress and Chanel No. 5 perfume?
questions.explanation: Coco Chanel revolutionized women's fashion and introduced Chanel No. 5 in 1921, one of the world's best-selling perfumes.

questions.text: What is the highest-grossing film of all time (not adjusted for inflation)?
questions.explanation: Avatar (2009) holds the record as the highest-grossing film of all time with over $2.9 billion worldwide.

questions.text: Which TikTok trend involved people pretending to be NPCs (non-player characters)?
questions.explanation: NPC Streaming became a major TikTok trend in 2023, with creators acting like video game NPCs repeating phrases on livestreams.

questions.text: Which comic book publisher created Superman?
questions.explanation: Superman first appeared in Action Comics #1 in 1938, published by DC Comics (then National Allied Publications).

questions.text: Who played the Joker in the 2019 film 'Joker'?
questions.explanation: Joaquin Phoenix won the Academy Award for Best Actor for his portrayal of Arthur Fleck in the 2019 film Joker.

questions.text: Which animated series features characters named Finn and Jake?
questions.explanation: Adventure Time (2010-2018) follows Finn the Human and Jake the Dog in the Land of Ooo.

questions.text: What was the name of Kim Kardashian and Kanye West's first child?
questions.explanation: North West was born on June 15, 2013, as the first child of Kim Kardashian and Kanye West.

questions.text: Which streaming service produced the series 'Squid Game'?
questions.explanation: Squid Game, a South Korean survival drama, premiered on Netflix in September 2021 and became its most-watched series.

questions.text: What is the name of the Infinity Stones wielder's glove in the Marvel Cinematic Universe?
questions.explanation: The Infinity Gauntlet is a metal glove designed to hold all six Infinity Stones, famously wielded by Thanos.

questions.text: Which reality competition show features aspiring fashion designers?
questions.explanation: Project Runway, originally hosted by Heidi Klum and judged by Tim Gunn, features designers competing in fashion challenges.

questions.text: Which actor played Captain Jack Sparrow in the Pirates of the Caribbean franchise?
questions.explanation: Johnny Depp created the iconic role of Captain Jack Sparrow, first appearing in The Curse of the Black Pearl (2003).

questions.text: What meme features a woman yelling at a confused white cat sitting at a dinner table?
questions.explanation: The Woman Yelling at a Cat meme combines a scene from Real Housewives of Beverly Hills with a photo of a cat named Smudge.

questions.text: Which boy band had members named Justin Timberlake and JC Chasez?
questions.explanation: *NSYNC, active from 1995 to 2002, featured Justin Timberlake, JC Chasez, Chris Kirkpatrick, Joey Fatone, and Lance Bass.

questions.text: In which TV show does a high school student named Eleven have telekinetic powers?
questions.explanation: Eleven, played by Millie Bobby Brown, is a central character in Stranger Things with psychokinetic abilities.

questions.text: Which Marvel character is known for saying 'I am Groot'?
questions.explanation: Groot, a tree-like creature from Guardians of the Galaxy, can only say the phrase 'I am Groot' in varying intonations.

questions.text: Which YouTube video was the first to reach one billion views?
questions.explanation: PSY's 'Gangnam Style' became the first YouTube video to reach one billion views in December 2012.

questions.text: Who created the comic book characters the X-Men?
questions.explanation: Stan Lee and Jack Kirby created the X-Men, who first appeared in The X-Men #1 in September 1963.

questions.text: Which TV series features dragons and is based on books by George R.R. Martin?
questions.explanation: Game of Thrones (2011-2019) is based on Martin's A Song of Ice and Fire series and prominently features dragons.

questions.text: Which pop star is known as the 'Queen of Pop'?
questions.explanation: Madonna has been referred to as the Queen of Pop since the 1980s, recognized for her influence on music and culture.

questions.text: What is the name of the AI assistant in the movie 'Her' (2013)?
questions.explanation: In the film Her, Joaquin Phoenix's character falls in love with an AI operating system named Samantha, voiced by Scarlett Johansson.

questions.text: Which Avenger wields a vibranium shield?
questions.explanation: Captain America's iconic circular shield is made of vibranium, a fictional metal from Wakanda.

questions.text: Which show features the catchphrase 'That's what she said'?
questions.explanation: Michael Scott, played by Steve Carell in The Office (US), is famous for frequently using the phrase 'That's what she said.'

questions.text: What was the first feature-length Pixar movie?
questions.explanation: Toy Story (1995) was Pixar's first feature film and the first entirely computer-animated feature film.

questions.text: Which celebrity chef is known for the phrase 'Bam!' and his Creole cooking?
questions.explanation: Emeril Lagasse is famous for his catchphrase 'Bam!' and his New Orleans-style Creole and Cajun cooking.

questions.text: Which DC Comics character is an Amazonian warrior princess?
questions.explanation: Wonder Woman, also known as Diana Prince, is an Amazonian warrior princess from the island of Themyscira.

questions.text: Which viral internet challenge involved dumping ice water over one's head for charity?
questions.explanation: The Ice Bucket Challenge went viral in 2014 to raise awareness and funds for ALS (amyotrophic lateral sclerosis).

questions.text: Who directed the film 'Pulp Fiction'?
questions.explanation: Quentin Tarantino wrote and directed Pulp Fiction (1994), which won the Palme d'Or at the Cannes Film Festival.

questions.text: Which anime series features a boy named Goku who searches for Dragon Balls?
questions.explanation: Dragon Ball, created by Akira Toriyama, follows Goku from childhood through adulthood as he trains in martial arts.

questions.text: Which social media platform uses the hashtag symbol (#) to categorize content?

options.A: All major platforms now use hashtags

questions.explanation: While Twitter popularized hashtags in 2007, virtually all major social media platforms now support hashtag categorization.

questions.text: What is the name of the fictional metal in the Marvel Universe that Wolverine's claws are coated with?
questions.explanation: Wolverine's skeleton and claws are bonded with adamantium, an virtually indestructible fictional metal alloy.

questions.text: Which TV show features a paper company called Dunder Mifflin?
questions.explanation: The Office (US) is set at the Scranton, Pennsylvania branch of the fictional Dunder Mifflin Paper Company.

questions.text: Which rapper's real name is Marshall Bruce Mathers III?
questions.explanation: Eminem, born Marshall Bruce Mathers III, is one of the best-selling music artists of all time.

questions.text: Which Netflix series is set in a women's prison?
questions.explanation: Orange Is the New Black (2013-2019) is set in the fictional Litchfield Penitentiary and was one of Netflix's first hit original series.

questions.text: What is the name of the dragon in the animated film 'Shrek'?
questions.explanation: The dragon in Shrek is simply called Dragon. She guards Princess Fiona's tower and later becomes Donkey's love interest.

questions.text: Which celebrity hosted the most episodes of 'Saturday Night Live' as of 2024?
questions.explanation: Alec Baldwin holds the record for most SNL hosting appearances, having hosted 17 times.

questions.text: Which MCU film features the snap that eliminates half of all life in the universe?
questions.explanation: In Avengers: Infinity War (2018), Thanos collects all six Infinity Stones and snaps his fingers, erasing half of all life.

questions.text: Which reality TV family is associated with the show 'Keeping Up with the Kardashians'?
questions.explanation: Keeping Up with the Kardashians (2007-2021) followed the Kardashian-Jenner family, including Kim, Khloe, Kourtney, and their parents.

questions.text: What does the meme 'This Is Fine' depict?

options.A: A cat sitting in a box
options.B: A dog sitting in a burning room
options.C: A man walking away from an explosion

questions.explanation: The 'This Is Fine' meme comes from a webcomic by KC Green showing a dog calmly drinking coffee in a room engulfed in flames.

questions.text: Which singer is known as 'Queen Bey'?
questions.explanation: Beyonce Knowles-Carter is often referred to as Queen Bey by her fans, known as the BeyHive.

questions.text: In 'The Mandalorian', what is the popular nickname fans gave to the Child?
questions.explanation: The Child, later revealed to be named Grogu, was widely called Baby Yoda by fans due to his resemblance to Yoda.

questions.text: Which app became famous for short-form lip-syncing videos before merging into TikTok?
questions.explanation: Musical.ly was a social media app for creating short lip-sync videos that merged with TikTok in August 2018.

questions.text: Which superhero team includes members like Cyclops, Storm, and Jean Grey?
questions.explanation: The X-Men are Marvel's team of mutant superheroes, with Cyclops, Storm, and Jean Grey among its most iconic members.

questions.text: Which TV show features the quote 'You know nothing, Jon Snow'?
questions.explanation: Ygritte repeatedly tells Jon Snow this iconic line in Game of Thrones, and it became one of the show's most quoted phrases.

questions.text: Who played the lead role in the movie 'Forrest Gump'?
questions.explanation: Tom Hanks won the Academy Award for Best Actor for his portrayal of Forrest Gump in the 1994 film.

questions.text: What is the name of SpongeBob's pet snail?
questions.explanation: Gary the Snail is SpongeBob SquarePants' pet, who meows like a cat in the animated series.

questions.text: Which fashion brand is known for its iconic red-soled shoes?
questions.explanation: Christian Louboutin's signature red lacquered soles have been a trademark of the luxury shoe brand since 1993.

questions.text: Which actor portrayed Wolverine in the X-Men film series?
questions.explanation: Hugh Jackman played Wolverine/Logan in X-Men films from 2000 to 2017, and returned in Deadpool & Wolverine (2024).

questions.text: Which streaming platform released 'The Mandalorian'?
questions.explanation: The Mandalorian was one of the launch titles for Disney+ in November 2019, set in the Star Wars universe.

questions.text: What video game franchise is Mario from?
questions.explanation: Mario is Nintendo's iconic mascot, starring in the Super Mario Bros. franchise since 1985.

questions.text: Which rapper is associated with the phrase 'Yeezy' as a brand name?
questions.explanation: Kanye West (now Ye) created the Yeezy brand, including a highly popular sneaker line originally in collaboration with Adidas.

questions.text: Which sitcom features six friends living in New York City and often gathering at Central Perk?
questions.explanation: Friends (1994-2004) follows six friends in New York City who frequently gather at the Central Perk coffee shop.

questions.text: What is the name of Thanos's home planet in the MCU?
questions.explanation: Thanos is from the planet Titan, which is shown as a ruined world in Avengers: Infinity War.

questions.text: Which animated show features characters named Rick and Morty traveling through dimensions?
questions.explanation: Rick and Morty, created by Justin Roiland and Dan Harmon, follows mad scientist Rick and his grandson Morty on interdimensional adventures.

questions.text: Which singer released the album 'Lemonade' in 2016?
questions.explanation: Beyonce released the visual album Lemonade on April 23, 2016, accompanied by an HBO special.

questions.text: In the Harry Potter series, what is the name of the three-headed dog guarding the trapdoor?
questions.explanation: Fluffy is the three-headed dog belonging to Hagrid that guards the trapdoor to the Philosopher's Stone.

questions.text: Which viral video featured a double rainbow and an extremely enthusiastic narrator?
questions.explanation: The Double Rainbow video, posted by Paul 'Bear' Vasquez in 2010, went viral for his ecstatic reaction to a double rainbow.

questions.text: Which TV series features a chemistry teacher's transformation and uses the periodic table in its logo?
questions.explanation: Breaking Bad's logo stylizes 'Br' and 'Ba' as periodic table elements (Bromine and Barium).

questions.text: Which Marvel villain is known as the 'Mad Titan'?
questions.explanation: Thanos, the main antagonist of the Infinity Saga, is known as the Mad Titan, obsessed with balancing the universe.

questions.text: Which celebrity couple was nicknamed 'Bennifer' by the media?
questions.explanation: Ben Affleck and Jennifer Lopez were dubbed 'Bennifer' during their early 2000s relationship and again when they reunited and married in 2022.

questions.text: Which animated Disney film features a character who must 'find their own way' on a voyage across the ocean?
questions.explanation: Moana (2016) follows the titular character as she sails across the Pacific Ocean to save her island, guided by the demigod Maui.
